utils

Class SupervisordClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.SupervisordClient

  • public class SupervisordClient
extends java.lang.Object

    Client class to communicate with supervisord xmlrpc2 interface. This class implement most of the Supervisord API

    Instantiate this class with supervisord host/port (and login information) and it will do the rest for you.

    Author:
    Cédric Sougné

      Contructor when http authentication is required

        public java.lang.Boolean clearLog()
                           throws org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

        Returns:
        always returns True unless error
        Throws:

      • getAPIVersion

        public java.lang.String getAPIVersion()
                               throws org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
        Return the version of the RPC API used by supervisord This API is versioned separately from Supervisor itself. The API version returned by getAPIVersion only changes when the API changes. Its purpose is to help the client identify with which version of the Supervisor API it is communicating.
        Returns:
        version id
        Throws:
        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

      • readLog

        public java.lang.String readLog(int offset,
                       int lenght)
                         throws org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
        Read length bytes from the main log starting at offset It can either return the entire log, a number of characters from the tail of the log, or a slice of the log specified by the offset and length parameters: Offset Length Behavior of readProcessLog Negative Not Zero Bad arguments. This will raise the fault BAD_ARGUMENTS. Negative Zero This will return the tail of the log, or offset number of characters from the end of the log. For example, if offset = -4 and length = 0, then the last four characters will be returned from the end of the log. Zero or Positive Negative Bad arguments. This will raise the fault BAD_ARGUMENTS. Zero or Positive Zero All characters will be returned from the offset specified. Zero or Positive Positive A number of characters length will be returned from the offset. If the log is empty and the entire log is requested, an empty string is returned. If either offset or length is out of range, the fault BAD_ARGUMENTS will be returned. If the log cannot be read, this method will raise either the NO_FILE error if the file does not exist or the FAILED error if any other problem was encountered. Note: The readLog() method replaces readMainLog() found in Supervisor versions prior to 2.1. It is aliased for compatibility but readMainLog() is deprecated and support will be dropped from Supervisor in a future version.
        Parameters:
        offset - offset to start reading from.
        lenght - length number of bytes to read from the log.
        Returns:
        result Bytes of log
        Throws:
        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

      • readProcessStderrLog

        public java.lang.String readProcessStderrLog(java.lang.String name,
                                    int offset,
                                    int lenght)

      • sendProcessStdin

        public java.lang.Boolean sendProcessStdin(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String chars)
                                   throws org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
        Send a string of chars to the stdin of the process name. If non-7-bit data is sent (unicode), it is encoded to utf-8 before being sent to the process’ stdin. If chars is not a string or is not unicode, raise INCORRECT_PARAMETERS. If the process is not running, raise NOT_RUNNING. If the process’ stdin cannot accept input (e.g. it was closed by the child process), raise NO_FILE.
        Parameters:
        name - The process name to send to (or ‘group:name’)
        chars - The character data to send to the process
        Returns:
        Always return True unless error
        Throws:
        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

      • sendRemoteCommEvent

        public java.lang.Boolean sendRemoteCommEvent(java.lang.String name,
                                    java.lang.String data)
                                      throws org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
        Send an event that will be received by event listener subprocesses subscribing to the RemoteCommunicationEvent.
        Parameters:
        name - String for the “type” key in the event header
        data - Data for the event body
        Returns:
        Always return True unless error
        Throws:
        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

      • tailProcessStderrLog

        public TailLog tailProcessStderrLog(java.lang.String name,
                           int offset,
                           int lenght)
                             throws org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
        Provides a more efficient way to tail the (stderr) log than readProcessStderrLog(). Use readProcessStderrLog() to read chunks and tailProcessStderrLog() to tail. Requests (length) bytes from the (name)’s log, starting at (offset). If the total log size is greater than (offset + length), the overflow flag is set and the (offset) is automatically increased to position the buffer at the end of the log. If less than (length) bytes are available, the maximum number of available bytes will be returned. (offset) returned is always the last offset in the log +1.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the process (or ‘group:name’)
        offset - offset to start reading from
        lenght - maximum number of bytes to return
        Returns:
        TailLog
        Throws:
        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException

      • tailProcessStdoutLog

        public TailLog tailProcessStdoutLog(java.lang.String name,
                           int offset,
                           int lenght)
                             throws org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
        Provides a more efficient way to tail the (stdout) log than readProcessStdoutLog(). Use readProcessStdoutLog() to read chunks and tailProcessStdoutLog() to tail. Requests (length) bytes from the (name)’s log, starting at (offset). If the total log size is greater than (offset + length), the overflow flag is set and the (offset) is automatically increased to position the buffer at the end of the log. If less than (length) bytes are available, the maximum number of available bytes will be returned. (offset) returned is always the last offset in the log +1.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the process (or ‘group:name’)
        offset - offset to start reading from
        lenght - maximum number of bytes to return
        Returns:
        TailLog
        Throws:
        org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException
